cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Kristy Advisory Number 23 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP122024 200 AM PDT Sun Oct 27 2024
...KRISTY FORECAST TO BECOME A POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE LATER TODAY...
SUMMARY OF 200 AM PDT...0900 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...22.0N 129.8W ABOUT 1270 MI...2045 KM W OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...50 MPH...85 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...NW OR 320 DEGREES AT 7 MPH...11 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1003 MB...29.62 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND OUTLOOK ---------------------- At 200 AM PDT (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Kristy was located near latitude 22.0 North, longitude 129.8 West. Kristy is moving toward the northwest near 7 mph (11 km/h). A turn toward the west at a slower forward speed is expected later today.
Maximum sustained winds have decreased to near 50 mph (85 km/h) with higher gusts. Additional weakening is forecast today, and Kristy is expected to become a post-tropical cyclone later today and dissipate on Monday.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 160 miles (260 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1003 mb (29.62 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- SURF: Swells generated by Kristy are affecting portions of the west coast of the Baja California peninsula and will likely continue to impact the region through the weekend. These swells are likely to cause life-threatening surf and rip current conditions. Please consult products from your local weather office.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Papin
NNNN
